seisflows3.tests.test_solver

Test suite for the SeisFlows3 system module, which controls interaction with various compute systems

Module Contents

Functions

Copy the template parameter file into the temporary test directory

Return a list of subclasses that falls under the System module

Re-used function that will initate a SeisFlows3 working environment in

Test code by importing all available classes for this module.

Test out path and parameter validation, essentially checking that all

Ensure that the required parameters are set in all the classes/subclasses

Make sure that the named, required functions exist within the class

seisflows3.tests.test_solver.MODULE = solver
seisflows3.tests.test_solver.REQUIRED_PARAMETERS = ['MATERIALS', 'DENSITY', 'ATTENUATION']

seisflows3.tests.test_solver.copy_par_file(tmpdir)

Copy the template parameter file into the temporary test directory :rtype: str :return: location of the parameter file

seisflows3.tests.test_solver.modules()

Return a list of subclasses that falls under the System module

seisflows3.tests.test_solver.sfinit(tmpdir, copy_par_file)

Re-used function that will initate a SeisFlows3 working environment in sys modules :return:

seisflows3.tests.test_solver.test_import(sfinit, modules)

Test code by importing all available classes for this module. If any of these fails then the module itself has some code error (e.g., syntax errors, inheritance errors).

seisflows3.tests.test_solver.test_validate(sfinit, modules)

Test out path and parameter validation, essentially checking that all the paths and parameters are set properly

Note

This doesn’t work because we have required parameters that are not set in the default parameter file. We can run configure beforehand but does that make sense?

Returns

seisflows3.tests.test_solver.test_required_parameters_exist(sfinit, modules)

Ensure that the required parameters are set in all the classes/subclasses That is, that the parameters defined above in REQUIRED_PARAMETERS have been defined by each SYSTEM class

seisflows3.tests.test_solver.test_required_functions_exist(sfinit, modules)

Make sure that the named, required functions exist within the class Do not execute just make sure they’re defined, because they will be expected by other modules
